body:
- This is an invalid value for that enum type.
- All that code will silently break when the enum datatype is changed.

Do we have similar instances of that “idiom” in the current codebase?

comment_data.body: `ag 'TOX_[0-9A-Z_]+ \+ 1' | grep -v LENGTH` returns only one occasion where a enum member is incremented.

@pranomostro Yes, and fixing it requires, as far as I can see, an API-breaking change.
I guess that's why @iphydf set the v0.2 milestone

This is just a few lines of code to set a new default.

The question is, do we simply use STATUS_NORMAL?

Or do we want to try to handle the invalid case again?

labels.description: Internal code cleanup, possibly affecting semantics, e.g. deleting a deprecated feature.
labels.name: cleanup

title: Get rid of TOX_USER_STATUS_BUSY + 1
